      <p>Assistant professor in Quaternary Geology and Biogeography affiliated with the <a href="https://www.biomac.org/">Biogeography and Macroecology</a> research group withing the <a href="https://ibed.uva.nl/content/research-departments/theoretical-and-computational-ecology/theoretical-and-computational-ecology.html">Department of Theoretical and Computational Ecology</a> in the <a href="https://ibed.uva.nl/">Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics</a> at the University of Amsterdam. Dr. Kenneth Rijsdijk's <strong>research interests</strong> include:</p>
      
      <ul class="mb-0">
        <li>How landscape dynamics affects ecosystems and evolutionary processes.</li>
        <li>Islands, nature reserves and connectivity in the agricultural landscapes.</li>
        <li>How human induced landscape change exceeds the rates of natural landscape dynamics.</li>
        <li>How we can harmonise humans actions in the landscape with nature.</li>
        <li>+Actionable Research Agenda, towards a net positive and accountable effect for nature in all his projects.</li>
        <li>GIS, remote sensing, LiDAR and spatial modelling (TABS) to analyse the landscape.</li>
